visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the title 'Monthly Sales Trend (May-Aug)'. The x-axis should display the months May, June, July, and August. The y-axis should show the sales data in thousands of dollars. The chart should have a single series named 'Sales' with the data [206, 216, 247, 330]. The chart should have a white background and a legend positioned at the bottom. The x-axis labels should be in a 12px Arial font, and the y-axis labels should be in a 10px Verdana font with a dark gray color.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with specific visual and functional attributes. The chart type is set to 'column', and it has a white background for a clean appearance. The title of the chart is 'Monthly Sales Trend (May-Aug)', which is displayed prominently at the top. The x-axis is labeled with the months May, June, July, and August, with labels styled in 12px Arial font. The y-axis displays sales data in thousands of dollars, formatted as '{value}k $', with labels styled in 10px Verdana font and a dark gray color for better readability. The chart includes a single series named 'Sales' with the data [206, 216, 247, 330], representing the sales figures for each month. Additionally, a legend is included at the bottom of the chart, centered and horizontally aligned, to provide context for the data series.
